description: High-difficulty logical reasoning scenarios where scheduling requirements are NOT immediately apparent. These involve hidden interdependencies where seemingly irrelevant teams/matches must be synchronized due to indirect cascading effects on tiebreakers, goal difference margins, or opponent determination.
core_challenge: Identify which 'seemingly irrelevant' matches must be simultaneous and explain the hidden logical chain

scenarios.title: 1982 World Cup Disgrace of Gijón - Exact Margin Dependency
scenarios.critical_context: Algeria has ALREADY FINISHED their matches (beat Chile 3-2 on June 24). West Germany vs Austria plays the NEXT DAY (June 25).
scenarios.scenario_question: Algeria is eliminated with 4 points. West Germany vs Austria play tomorrow. Why does the EXACT scoreline matter, not just win/loss/draw?

the_hidden_dependency.if_germany_wins_1_0: Germany 4pts +3GD, Austria 4pts +2GD, Algeria 4pts 0GD → Germany & Austria advance
the_hidden_dependency.if_germany_wins_2_0: Germany 4pts +4GD, Austria 4pts +1GD, Algeria 4pts 0GD → Germany & Austria advance
the_hidden_dependency.if_germany_wins_3_0: Germany 4pts +5GD, Austria 4pts 0GD, Algeria 4pts 0GD → GOALS SCORED tiebreaker: Algeria 5 > Austria 3 → ALGERIA ADVANCES
the_hidden_dependency.if_germany_wins_4_0_or_more: Germany 4pts +6GD, Austria 4pts -1GD, Algeria 4pts 0GD → Germany & Algeria advance, AUSTRIA ELIMINATED

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: A BIGGER German win is WORSE for their European ally Austria. The exact margin (not just result) determines whether Algeria (already finished) qualifies. Each goal changes the outcome.
scenarios.what_actually_happened: Germany won 1-0 (goal in 10th minute), then both teams stopped attacking for 80 minutes - knowing exactly the margin needed
scenarios.why_scheduling_failed: Algeria played a FULL DAY before Germany vs Austria, allowing the Europeans to calculate the exact 'safe zone' (1-0 or 2-0)
scenarios.rule_change_caused: FIFA mandated ALL final group matches must be simultaneous after this scandal

scenarios.title: Euro 2004 Scandinavian Stitch-Up - Third Team Elimination Without Playing
scenarios.scenario_question: Italy plays already-eliminated Bulgaria. Denmark plays Sweden. Why is Italy's fate ALREADY SEALED before they even kick off?

the_hidden_dependency.if_all_three_finish_on_5_points: Mini-table uses GOALS SCORED in H2H matches
the_hidden_dependency.critical_insight: If Denmark-Sweden ends 2-2: Sweden has 3 H2H goals, Denmark has 2, Italy has 1
the_hidden_dependency.result: Italy ELIMINATED despite going UNBEATEN in the tournament

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: Italy beats Bulgaria 2-1 and finishes on 5 points UNDEFEATED, but the 2-2 draw between Denmark and Sweden (where both teams qualify) eliminates Italy through H2H goals scored in the mini-league
scenarios.what_actually_happened: Denmark 2-2 Sweden (exact result that mutually qualified both). Italy won 2-1 vs Bulgaria but was eliminated. Italy accused Scandinavians of match-fixing ('biscotto')
scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: If Italy played first and won big, they could have pressured Denmark/Sweden to need bigger margins. Simultaneous play prevented tactical adjustments

scenarios.title: Premier League 2008 - Portsmouth Has Nothing to Play For

safe_team.status: FA Cup winners, European football secured, NOTHING to play for in league

scenarios.scenario_question: Portsmouth are FA Cup winners with nothing at stake. Why must Portsmouth vs Fulham kick off simultaneously with Reading vs Derby?

the_hidden_dependency.portsmouth_motivation: Zero - they have nothing to play for
the_hidden_dependency.if_portsmouth_plays_first: Reading knows exact GD margin needed vs relegated Derby

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: Portsmouth's effort level (despite having nothing to play for) determines whether Reading can calculate their exact required goal margin against already-relegated Derby
scenarios.what_actually_happened: Fulham won 1-0 at Portsmouth (Danny Murphy 76'). Reading beat Derby 4-0 but still relegated on GD (-22 vs -25). Portsmouth's professional performance sealed Reading's fate
scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: If Portsmouth vs Fulham played early and Fulham lost, Reading would know they only need to avoid defeat. If Fulham won, Reading would know exact GD target

scenarios.title: Premier League 2005 - Charlton's Meaningless Equalizer

safe_team.status: Completely safe, no European hopes, no relegation danger

scenarios.scenario_question: Charlton (11th, safe) play Crystal Palace. Why does this 'dead rubber' for Charlton matter?

the_hidden_dependency.crystal_palace_situation: Need win to be safe (currently 17th on 32 pts)
the_hidden_dependency.west_brom_situation: Bottom with 31 pts, need Palace to drop points
the_hidden_dependency.charlton_motivation: None - mid-table with nothing at stake

what_actually_happened.minute_82: Jonathan Fortune (Charlton) scores equalizer from free-kick to make it 2-2
what_actually_happened.result: Palace draw 2-2, fail to get win they needed
what_actually_happened.cascade_effect: West Brom win 2-0 vs Portsmouth, survive (first team to survive despite being bottom at Christmas)

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: A mid-table player's late equalizer in a 'meaningless' match became the most important goal of the season, relegating Crystal Palace
scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: If West Brom played first and lost, Palace would know a draw is enough. If Palace played first and won, West Brom would know they need a win

scenarios.title: 2018 World Cup - Eliminated Poland Determines Japan's Strategy
scenarios.scenario_question: Poland is eliminated with 0 points. Why does Japan vs Poland matter when Poland has nothing to play for?

the_hidden_dependency.tiebreaker_situation: Japan and Senegal identical on points, GD, goals scored, H2H (2-2 draw)

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: Japan's match against ELIMINATED Poland became about avoiding yellow cards while monitoring Colombia-Senegal, not about winning

what_actually_happened.poland_scores: 59th minute - Jan Bednarek gives Poland 1-0 lead
what_actually_happened.japan_response: Rather than chase equalizer, Japan ACCEPTS the defeat
what_actually_happened.the_controversy: Japan passes ball around their own half for final 10+ minutes
what_actually_happened.reasoning: Pushing for goal risks yellow cards or conceding on counter, losing fair play advantage
what_actually_happened.result: Japan lose 0-1 to eliminated Poland but ADVANCE on fair play over Senegal

scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: If Japan vs Poland played first, Senegal would know exact scenario. Simultaneous scheduling meant Japan monitored other match while playing eliminated team
scenarios.historical_significance: First time in World Cup history fair play tiebreaker was used

scenarios.title: Netherlands vs Portugal Coefficient - Sporting's Loss Helps Feyenoord
scenarios.scenario_question: Portugal has more total points (75 vs 67.5). Why does Sporting CP losing to Juventus help NETHERLANDS overtake PORTUGAL in coefficient ranking?

the_hidden_dependency.the_divisor_effect: Coefficient = Total Points / Number of Clubs
the_hidden_dependency.if_sporting_wins: Portugal earns 2+ bonus points, stays ahead
the_hidden_dependency.if_sporting_loses: Portugal doesn't earn advancement points, Netherlands overtakes

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: Netherlands has FEWER total points but HIGHER average because they divide by fewer clubs. A Portuguese team losing actually helps the Netherlands coefficient because it prevents Portugal from earning bonus points that would maintain their lead

result_and_consequences.what_happened: Sporting lost to Juventus, Feyenoord beat Roma
result_and_consequences.6th_place_benefit: TWO automatic Champions League group stage spots
result_and_consequences.7th_place_penalty: Only ONE automatic group stage spot

scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: All Europa League knockout matches scheduled same evening. If staggered, teams could adjust based on other results' coefficient implications

scenarios.title: Bundesliga 2019 - Union Berlin vs Paderborn for Stuttgart's Opponent
scenarios.scenario_question: Stuttgart (Bundesliga) will play winner of 3rd place in 2. Bundesliga. Why do Bochum vs Union and Dresden vs Paderborn need to be simultaneous?

the_hidden_dependency.current_situation: Paderborn 2nd (57 pts, +21 GD), Union Berlin 3rd (57 pts, +12 GD)
the_hidden_dependency.if_paderborn_wins_and_union_draws: Paderborn stays 2nd (automatic promotion), Union stays 3rd (playoff vs Stuttgart)
the_hidden_dependency.if_union_wins_and_paderborn_loses: Union jumps to 2nd (automatic promotion), Paderborn drops to 3rd (playoff vs Stuttgart)

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: Stuttgart's playoff opponent (Paderborn vs Union Berlin) was determined by matches Stuttgart had NO involvement in
scenarios.result: Union Berlin stayed 3rd, beat Stuttgart in playoff (2-2, 0-0 - away goals), Stuttgart relegated to 2. Bundesliga
scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: If one 2. Bundesliga match finished first, the other team would know if they're playing Stuttgart or getting automatic promotion

scenarios.title: La Liga 2015 Three-Way Tie - Eibar Wins But Gets Relegated
scenarios.scenario_question: All three teams on 32 points. If all win and reach 35 points, who gets relegated? Does Eibar's final day result even matter?

the_hidden_dependency.the_paradox: Eibar's HEAD-TO-HEAD results from MONTHS EARLIER seal their fate
the_hidden_dependency.calculation: If all three finish on 35 points, mini-table kicks in based on their 4 matches against each other
the_hidden_dependency.eibar_h2h_record: Only 2 points from 4 matches against Deportivo and Granada
the_hidden_dependency.what_eibar_did: Won 3-0 vs Córdoba on final day
the_hidden_dependency.what_it_changed: NOTHING - they were still relegated based on earlier H2H results

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: Eibar won their final match convincingly but their fate was sealed by results from weeks/months prior. The 'hidden' teams were Deportivo and Granada whose earlier season H2H results determined Eibar's relegation
scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: Even though outcome was predetermined by H2H, all matches needed to be simultaneous to ensure fair competition (teams might not realize the mathematical inevitability)

scenarios.title: 2024-25 Champions League Fixed Bracket Cascade
scenarios.competition: UEFA Champions League (New League Phase Format)
scenarios.scenario_question: Celtic has ALREADY qualified for playoffs (secured top 24). Why does Celtic's exact finishing position (21st vs 22nd) matter?

the_hidden_dependency.if_celtic_21st_city_22nd: Celtic plays Bayern (12th), City plays Real Madrid (11th)
the_hidden_dependency.if_celtic_22nd_city_21st: Celtic plays Real Madrid (11th), City plays Bayern (12th)
the_hidden_dependency.celtic_dilemma: Does Celtic prefer Bayern (managed by former City captain Kompany) or Real Madrid?
the_hidden_dependency.city_dilemma: Does City prefer Real Madrid (historic rival) or Bayern?

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: Celtic's 'dead rubber' match against Young Boys determines whether they face Bayern Munich or Real Madrid in playoffs - a massive difference in opponent quality despite Celtic being already qualified
scenarios.what_actually_happened: City beat Brugge 3-1, finished 22nd. Celtic drew with Young Boys, finished 21st. Celtic got Bayern, City got Real Madrid
scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: If City's match finished first, Celtic would know exact scenario and could adjust their intensity/lineup. All 18 final league phase matches kicked off simultaneously

scenarios.title: Premier League 1996 - Leeds' 0-0 Draw Triggers City Relegation

safe_team.status: Completely safe, nothing to play for

scenarios.scenario_question: Leeds are safe in 13th. Why does their match against Coventry need to be simultaneous with Manchester City vs Liverpool?

the_hidden_dependency.leeds_motivation: None - Howard Wilkinson's team has nothing at stake
the_hidden_dependency.coventry_needs: Any result that keeps them above City on GD
the_hidden_dependency.city_needs: Other results to go their way
the_hidden_dependency.the_cascade: Leeds' effort level determines Coventry's result, which determines City's fate

what_actually_happened.the_infamous_moment: City manager Alan Ball told his players wrong information about other scores
what_actually_happened.city_time_wasting: City players passed ball around thinking they were safe based on false info
what_actually_happened.result: City relegated on inferior goal difference (-25 vs -17 for Coventry)

scenarios.non_obvious_insight: Leeds' goalless draw with Coventry (a match Leeds had zero incentive to win) ensured Coventry survived, while City's misunderstanding of the tactical situation relegated them
scenarios.why_scheduling_mattered: If Leeds vs Coventry played first, City would know exact scenario. The simultaneous scheduling with incorrect information flow (pre-smartphone era) created the famous misinformation tragedy

evaluation_guidelines.expected_output: Identify which seemingly irrelevant match must be simultaneous and explain the hidden logical chain
evaluation_guidelines.difficulty_level: Very High - requires recognizing indirect dependencies
evaluation_guidelines.key_challenge: Model must see beyond obvious 'same points' scenarios to understand cascading effects
skills_tested: Understanding coefficient mathematics and divisor effects
Head-to-head mini-table construction with third-party effects
Goal difference margin calculations across matches
common_pitfalls: Only identifying teams 'competing for same spot' as needing synchronization
Not recognizing how exact margins (not just win/loss) change outcomes
Overlooking how third team changes H2H mini-table rankings

pattern_categories.safe_team_determines_outcome: Mid-table team with nothing to play for affects relegation through effort level
pattern_categories.eliminated_team_enables_strategy: Already-eliminated team's result allows tactical manipulation by others
pattern_categories.exact_margin_dependency: Each goal changes the mathematical outcome, not just win/draw/loss
pattern_categories.h2h_mini_table_paradox: Third team joining tie reverses ranking of other two teams
pattern_categories.coefficient_divisor_effect: Fewer participating clubs means higher average despite lower total points
pattern_categories.cross_division_cascade: Lower division result determines higher division playoff opponent

metadata.author: Claude Code
metadata.purpose: High-difficulty evaluation dataset testing recognition of hidden interdependencies in sports scheduling
metadata.improvement_over_v1: Focuses on non-obvious scenarios where casual observers would question the scheduling requirement
